attributes.action: For the Government to pursue a Free trade area with the  Commonwealth of Nations
attributes.additional_details:
As of the vote to leave the EU, the UK already has a free trade deal (through the EU) with the common wealth countries of ;  South africa, Papua New Guinea ,Cameroon,Belize and Guyana. 

That the UK inside the EU had already laid much of the ground work for a Free trade deal with Canada. 

UK’s exports to Commonwealth countries have been increasing at over 10% a year – with increases (over two years) of 33% to India, 31% to South Africa, 30% to Australia and 18% to Canada.
attributes.background: Collectively the Commonwealth has some of the largest economies in the world. In 2005 the commonwealth meeting in Malta it was agree that a commonwealth free trade area would be endorsed. It is now possible for this to be achieved as we have left the EU.
